III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to

Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A male staff member entered a youth's bedroom and touched her
breast over the youth's clothing.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker and on
7/27/2023 at Kids Talk Children’s Advocacy Center. Youth A
reported she has been at the facility for a month and feels safe.
Youth A reported a staff named Mr. David touched her on her
breast over her clothing in the middle of the night on 6/21/2023-
6/22/2023 however during the Kids Talk interview Youth A
reported it occurred on 6/23/2023. Youth A reported a “Caucasian
male” staff came into her room in the middle of the night to wake
her up to use the bathroom as she sometimes has accidents at
night. Youth A reported the male staff came into her room and
said her name and when she was getting out of the bed to go to
the bathroom, the male staff placed both hands on her breast.
Youth A reported the male staff had one hand on each of her
breast in a gripping position. Youth A reported he did this for one
to two minutes. During the Kids Talk interview, Youth A reported
initially she was still sleeping in her bed when the male staff was
touching her breast and then stated she was sitting up getting
ready to go to the bathroom when he touched her breast. Youth A
reported the male staff did not say anything to her while he was
2

touching her breast. Youth A reported she began screaming and
no one came so she ran out of her bedroom to the bathroom and
locked herself in the bathroom. Youth A reported when she came
out from using the bathroom, the male staff was out in the living
area with a female staff. Youth A did not know the female staff’s
name and stated she was short in stature and bigger in size.
Youth A had never seen this female staff before. Youth A went
back into her bedroom and closed the door. Youth A reported the
male staff told her to call him Mr. David and described him as a
taller, young, “Caucasian male”, with a deep voice. Youth A
reported she did not recall what he was wearing. Youth A
reported this was the first time the male staff came into her
bedroom. Youth A reported she did not tell Administrator the
staff’s name because she did not want to get the staff in trouble
and was afraid or retaliation. Youth A reported she has not seen
the male staff since that night and that was the only time she has
ever seen him before. Youth A reported she has been sexually
assaulted in the past prior to placement at the facility. Youth A
reported this was the only time she has been touched sexually at
the facility.
Youth B was interviewed via Teams on 7/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported she has
never heard a youth scream in the night. Youth B has heard
Youth A crying in her room during the day and evening and Youth
A banging her head. Youth B reported staff perform checks on
youth at night. Youth B has never seen a male staff perform
checks on youth. Male staff may participate in security checks of
youth’s rooms however these only occur when another female
staff is present. Youth B does not know of any male staff at the
facility named Mr. David.
Youth C was interviewed via Teams on 7/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C reported she has
never heard a youth scream at night between the hours of 11pm-
7am. Staff complete checks on youth at night. Youth C reported
only female staff complete checks and male staff are not allowed
down the halls when the youth are sleeping. Youth C reported
she has never seen a male staff enter the youth’s bedrooms.
Youth C did not know any staff by the name Mr. David. Youth C
reported she has never seen a male staff work the overnight shift.
Youth D was interviewed via Teams on 7/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth D reported staff
complete night checks on youth while youth are sleeping. Staff
look through the youth’s bedroom window to complete checks and
3

do not enter the youths’ bedrooms. Youth D reported mainly
female staff work night shifts. Youth D reported she has seen
male staff work the night shift however was not able to provide
any names of who. Youth D reported she did not know a male
staff by the name Mr. David. Youth D reported she did not know
any White males that worked at the facility.
Administrator/ Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at
the facility on 6/27/2023 and via Teams on 7/28/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Administrator reported he is
not aware of Youth A being woke up by staff in the middle of the
night to use the bathroom. All youth’s bedroom doors are locked
during sleeping hours of 11pm-7am. Administrator reported there
is not a male staff at the facility by the name Mr. David and no
staff that fit the physical description Youth A provided.
Administrator reported youths’ bedroom doors close on their own
and cannot stay open unless there is an object propping the door
open. If staff are inside a youth’s room, staff can use a key or the
key fob to swipe to get out. Administrator reported the facilities
best practice is to not have male staff completing rounds and
checks on youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 7/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported he works
the morning shift at the facility and occasionally picks up overtime
on the afternoon shift however is never at the facility the full
afternoon shift. Staff 1 reported he has never worked an overnight
shift at the facility. Staff 1 reported male staff can assist in shift
security checks of youth’s rooms and this is where staff ensure
there is no contraband in the youth’s bedroom. When male staff
participate in security checks, the male staff stands at the door
and the female staff go into the room and look for contraband.
Staff 1 reported male staff do not perform checks on youth in their
bedrooms. Staff 1 reported there are no White male staff that are
direct care workers at the facility. Staff 1 reported he has never
entered Youth A’s bedroom.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 7/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 works the morning
shift at the facility from 7am-3:30pm. Youth A disclosed during a
visit with her mother, while Staff 2 was present in the visit, a male
staff came into her bedroom at the facility and touched her when
the staff was supposed to wake her up for the bathroom. Staff 2
reported Youth A stated the staff’s name was Mr. David and that
he was an older White male. Staff 2 reported there are no White
male staff at the facility with that name or that fit the description.
4

Staff 2 reported the only male that works the night shift that she is
aware of is the supervisor who is Black. Staff 2 reported she has
never seen a male staff complete a security check on youth’s
bedrooms at the facility. Female staff complete the night checks
on youth. Staff 2 reported male staff are required to announce
themselves before entering the bedroom hall wings at the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 7/31/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported Youth A
initially reported to her while at a prior foster home she was
touched inappropriately. Youth A was saying “Don’t touch me
David” while sitting with Staff 3. Staff 3 described this as Youth A
hallucinating and having an out of body experience. Staff 3
reported there are no male staff at the facility by the name David
or Mr. David. Staff 3 reported female staff always complete
nightly checks on youth. Male staff do not complete night checks
and if a male staff were to go down the youth’s bedroom hall, the
male staff must announce themselves and be with a female staff.
MDHHS worker does not have any findings in this
investigation.
Video Reviewed:

Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report 1 dated 6/23/2023 at 9pm: Youth A refused
to go into her room for bedtime. Youth A reported there
were spirits in her room that follows her and tells her to kill
herself. Youth A was given support and time to feel safe.
Youth A returned to her bedroom for the night and laid
down. Youth A then began screaming “No, no, no David
please don’t” and “David stop touching me please no.”
Youth A then got out of bed and began banging her head
6

• Incident report 2 dated 6/23/2023 at 12:30pm: Youth A was

• Incident report 4 dated 6/23/2023 at 9:30am: Youth A had a

• Vista Maria Human Resources Employee Guide: Employee
Behavior policy states staff are to maintain the highest level
of appropriate personal and professional conduct and
performance both on and off campus and demonstrate
behavior that exhibits respectful and professional
boundaries, at all times. Employees are prohibited from
engaging in any form of sexual or other forms of harassing
or bullying behavior.
• Vista Maria Male staff listing indicates there are no staff by
the name Mr. David. All male staff races are indicated as
“Black” or “African American” except one who is listed as
two or more races.
• Youth A’s hygiene plan effective 6/12/2023: Youth A will be
woken up by staff at least once per night between 3am-
4am to use the bathroom.
• Staff 1’s shifts worked from 6/7/2023 (when Youth A arrived
at the facility) through 6/23/2023 evidenced by times Staff 1
clocked into work. Staff 1 did not work any overnight shifts.
7

• Vista Maria Observation logs from 6/18/2023-6/24/2023:
The observation logs all indicate female staff completing
checks.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Youth A reported a
“Caucasian male” staff by the name Mr. David came into her room
and touched her breast. Youth A changed the timeframe during
the initial interview and interview with Kids Talk. To ensure the
timeframes were addressed, video footage of night checks from
6/17/2023 through 6/23/2023 were viewed and at no time was a
White male completing checks on Youth A, nor did a male ever
enter Youth A’s bedroom. Only female staff completed checks on
Youth A per the video footage reviewed. Observation logs were
reviewed and there were no males completing the observation
logs during the hours of 11pm-7am. The facility does not have
anyone by the name Mr. David employed. Staff 1 was the only
staff employed at the facility with a name close to Mr. David and
he is not White. Staff 1’s times worked were reviewed and Staff 1
did not work any overnight shifts from 6/7/2023 when Youth A
arrived at the facility to 6/23/2023, and Staff 1 reported he has
never worked an overnight at the facility. The facility does not
have any direct care White male staff employed.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It was recommended the facility discuss Youth A’s hygiene plan
with the staff to ensure staff are following Youth A’s hygiene plan
as out of the six nights of video footage reviewed, Youth A was
not woken by staff on two of the nights.
It was recommended the facility review with staff documentation of
varying interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes as upon
reviewing the observation log it was noticed staff are not
documenting the time checks are actually occurring, but on the
fifteen-minute mark.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
